main event: On January 15, 1955, an object described as an oblong, highly luminous object was observed in Kalispell, Montana.
interesting points: The object was reported to be traveling at high speed, possibly a meteor., The observation was momentary with insufficient data for analysis., The object was described as having the potential to explode., A subsequent report on January 25, 1955, detailed a similar sighting of a grey, elongated object moving at high speed., Observers from the local area participated in the sighting.
